intro: Siphocampylus imbricatus var. casarettoi, commonly known as the Casaretto's siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
